content: Sure, I'll update the button text to "Hadoken".
Change the getting started button to say hadoken

{"status": "success", "ui_elements_checklist": [{"feature": "Add a Shoryuken button next to the Hadoken button for diverse actions.", "checked": true}, {"feature": "Implement customizable button skins, allowing users to personalize the Hadoken and Shoryuken buttons.", "checked": false}, {"feature": "Add sound effects for the Hadoken and Shoryuken buttons to enhance interaction.", "checked": true}, {"feature": "Integrate a feedback form specifically for suggestions on new buttons or features.", "checked": false}, {"feature": "Implement animation effects for the Hadoken button press, creating a more engaging user experience.", "checked": true}, {"feature": "Introduce a leader board for users who trade the most toilet paper, incentivizing use of the Hadoken and Shoryuken features.", "checked": false}], "input_token_count": 500, "output_token_count": 179, "time_taken": "0:00:07.457602"}
"You got it! Adding a Hadoken button for you."

{"status": "success", "qna": [{"question 1": "Where would you like the Hadoken button to be placed within the app?", "option1": "On the main trading interface near the search bar", "option2": "In the user profile section for easy access"}, {"question 2": "What specific action should the Hadoken button trigger?", "option1": "Initiate a unique trading request to other users", "option2": "Open a special offer or discount section on the platform"}], "input_token_count": 582, "output_token_count": 105, "time_taken": "0:00:02.680794"}
Got it. Adding a Hadoken button to the project.

{"status": "success", "ui_elements_checklist": [{"feature": "Live status updates for Santa's availability", "checked": true}, {"feature": "Automated response after form submission with estimated reply time", "checked": true}, {"feature": "Option to attach a wishlist or images with the form", "checked": false}, {"feature": "Customizable greeting options for the form ('Dear Santa', 'Hello Santa', etc.)", "checked": false}, {"feature": "Integration of a countdown timer to Christmas on the form page", "checked": true}, {"feature": "Feedback section post-contact for user experience improvement", "checked": false}], "input_token_count": 537, "output_token_count": 118, "time_taken": "0:00:05.474904"}
Will add a contact form for Santa to the website.

In a conversation between the user and the AI assistant, the user requested multiple enhancements for a project, specifically the addition of a 'Contact Santa' form and a 'Hadoken' button. The AI confirmed each request, stating it would implement the features. Initially, the user was asked about the positioning of the 'Contact Santa' form, with options presented for it to be on the main navigation menu or as a pop-up from every page. The user also needed to specify the information required from users, where options included just name, email, and message or additionally a wish list upload. 

Following that, the conversation shifted towards adding the 'Hadoken' button. The user was again prompted for its desired placement, either in the main navigation bar or the user profile section, and for functionality, whether it should trigger a unique animation or open a special offers page. The AI noted it would add the Hadoken button along with associated features like animations and sound effects. Throughout this back-and-forth, the user continuously reiterated the request for the 'Hadoken' button.

The conversation also covered further inquiries about the 'Shoryuken' button, where the same kind of questioning occurred regarding placement and functionality. With each feature request, the AI provided a list of additional features like live chat support and email forms that the user could consider. The user showed interest in implementing an email form to contact Santa, and again options were provided regarding its simplicity or detail. The AI consistently acknowledged the user's requests and confirmed its actions towards implementing each feature. Each interaction focused heavily on confirming the user's preferences for the various functionalities within the project.
